creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
medium:
Jizhou ware
Stoneware with brown glaze to the exterior with papercut decoration reserved in dark brown against a variegated buff ground on the interior
text: A dark-brown glaze with buff-colored tortoiseshell markings covers the exterior of this small tea bowl. Reserved on the interior in reddish-brown glaze are three openwork panels of quatrefoil shapes, perhaps representing peony blossoms, set against a richly variegated buff glaze. The golden buff glaze crawled downward from the lip during firing creating a streaked and mottled effect on the interior. Archaeological evidence shows similar bowls to have been made at the Jizhou kilns at Yonghe in central Jiangxi province.
title: Tea Bowl
